ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Last 25 years we are working for Thalassemia awareness. We organized seminars in more than 1000 education sector like Schools, Colleges, Adult education centre etc. We organized more than 1000 Blood donation camps, all collected Blood we give to Bhoruka Blood Bank, which is use for Thalassemia patients. Till we are doing this job. Here in Burdwan Town near Agree culture farm we built a 8000 sq.ft. Hospital name Thalassemia Hospital. The founder Kanai Bairgya attended International Conference for Thalassemia Awareness in Thailand, year 1999 and USA year 2000. In this long period we faced too much obstruction, but we overcome all and still working. Its not an easy work but till we continue. We give lots of people to the source of income from here. 30-40 men and women direct or indirect working for us.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Inception: The Calcutta Samaritans was born in 1971. Rev. Vijayan Pavamani, our founder, and his wife Premila Pavamani, our current Director, began their work to befriend the lonely in crisis, from the veranda of a small cottage that was their home. The Calcutta Samaritans is a registered, secular, autonomous and voluntary organisation. We have now been able to befriend a much wider range of persons with special needs. From the suicidal to the substance abuser through treatment and rehabilitation; from those at risk of STDs and AIDS to a larger group NGOs being trained in drug awareness and de-addiction; The Calcutta Samaritans has honed in to the marginalized for which the organization campaigns and advocates. The organization has grown beyond all expectation with over 150 Samaritans working day and night to ease pain, loneliness and suffering. Rev. Pavamani believed that those who came to us were not cases, or numbers, but persons in need, who needed to be cared for, and the person more important than their problems. By personal example in his lifetime, Rev. Vijayan Pavamani focused on the individual; proving that it is not the work itself, but the manner in which one does the work that is important. This is the work ethic that we have adopted. We strive to, quite simply, be there for those who come to us. The vision: The Calcutta Samaritans vision is a community that affirms the dignity and self-worth of the individual and ensures their holistic empowerment. The mission: We are a movement of people working to improve the quality of life of individuals in society: By listening, befriending and counseling through education, healthcare and advocacy, rehabilitation, self-scheme projects and job-skills development for the upliftment of the community. The following are the projects/departments of the organization:  Awareness Assistance and Counselling Centre for substance abuse  De-addiction centre supported by MSJE at Kolkata and Jamshedpur  Long term rehabilitation and aftercare centre for substance abusers  Targeted intervention for IDUs and FSWs supported SACS  Regional Resource and Training Centre supported by MSJE  Campaign and advocacy supported by Actionaid  Vocational rehabilitation & job skills training centre  Work place prevention programmes in Kolkata and at Jamshedpur  Pathological laboratory

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Facets of Activities of the Institute of Social Research and Applied Anthropology(ISRAA) The Institute of Social Research & Applied Anthropology had, since its inception in 1955 had been engaged in activities related to social welfare, research studies, action research, cultural promotion of indigenous population etc. in different parts of West Bengal and neighbouring states. Many great personalities like Prof. Nirmal Kumar Bose, Prof. Probodh Kumar Bhowmick, Dr. J.K. Bose, Prof. L.P. Vidyarthi, etc., to name a few, had been the principal source of inspiration and actions research in this organization. Till date it had conducted many academic research as well as action research with actual implementation concerning poverty alleviation, social awareness, capacity building and other livelihood improvement programmes. It has with its experts and staff, significant experience of evaluation and assessment related project execution in and urban development fronts. A. Action & Applied Research: 1. Since inception 8 Nos. of Research Projects on various issues related to Tribal Development livelihood programme etc. in general and Lodha, a primitive tribe West Bengal. was carried out by the staff and scholars of the institute. The projects were duly sponsored by Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Govt. of India. 2. During 2006-08 we executed a project entitled Empowerment of Tribal Women through Batik Print: Training cum Production sponsored by Dept. of Science & Technology, Govt. of India. New Delhi. As a part of the project we trained 90 tribal women belongs to various tribal communities in and around Bidisha. In view of their show interest we formed 9 SHG,s. Out of 9 Nos. of SHGs except 2 others are functioning. 3. One Research Fellow namely Dr. Monali Goswami who attached with our institute and carrying out her research work entitled Nutritional Status among the mother & children of Bhumij of Orissa funded by Indian Council of Social Science Research, New Delhi. 4. In the field of education we are running 3 Ashrama Hostels - 2 for Boys and 1 for Girls exclusively for Lodha children. Ashrama Hostel which is residential where free food and lodging facilities being provided to the inmates duly financed by BCW Dept, Govt. of West Bengal. It is to be mentioned here the first Ashrama Hostel in the state of west Bengal . 5. Our existing land and pond are being utilized for commercial purpose in view of generating our own resources for sustainability on one hand and the other it is being used for demonstration purposes by inviting the experts time to time from IIT, KGP as well as concerned Agriculture Dept, Govt. of West Bengal to transfer the need based technology to the tribal and non tribal people living side by side in and around Bidisha. 6. We organized Aloe-Vera training for the youth farmer of the locality. The training was imparted by the faculty of Agriculture and Food Engineering Dept. IIT. KGP. 7. We have installed Bio- gas unit and vermi- compost plant to impart training facilities to the local tribal youth to provide the means of sustainable livelihood to the local people in view of entrepreneur development of Tribal Folk. 8. Very recently the District Sericulture Board established a Tasar-cum-Mulberi cultivation, training-cum- Production Unit at our Institute for employment and income generation in Paschim Medinipur. B. Organising National & International Level Seminar Since inception our institute very successfully organized 36 Nos. National seminars and 3 NOs. of International Seminars duly sponsored by the agency like Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Indian Council of Social Science Science Research, New Delhi, Anthropological Survey of India, Cultural Research Institute, West Bengal etc. The 4th International Seminar will be held during December, 4th to 5th 2016. C. Publication We are publishing very regularly a journal namely Man & Life 2 issues Jan- June & July  Dec. We feel proud by expressing, since last 37 years this journal covering all the branches of social science being published regularly. Altogether total 20 Nos. of books are being published by our institute under the heading Sparks from Bidisha D. Revival of Tribal Art & Culture With the aim of revival of tribal art & culture our Institute organizes every year  Navanna Utsav where different tribal communities are to perform their various cultural events which aregradually decaying due to impact of modern mass- media and telecommunication causing the identity crisis among the indigenous communities. Our Institute is putting its endeavor to provide a platform where the missing tribal cultural traits are being staged and this happens to be the eye opener before younger generation of various communities as a source of motivations and challenges. E. Eco-museum is located at our institute. There is enough scope for the expansion and popularization of ecologically sensitive activities in village life in terms of promotions and rejections. F. Throughout the year, the students of Rural Development, Anthropology, Bengali, History, Sociology, Folklore etc. of different colleges and universities of West Bengal and out side the state are organizing their field camps and workshops at our institute.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Founded in August of 2004 Lily Foundation is a non profit organization dedicated to providing beneficial programs to the people of India Our diverse focus on programs in Education Healthcare and Disaster Relief allows us to make a significant impact on Indian culture today and beyond We have built this foundation on the basic principles of humanity hope and honesty At Lily Foundation educating Indias less advantaged population is our primary focus Strategically we have identified four segments of the children population who must be supported in ways fitting to their needs Group 1 Basic Literacy Group Group 2 Low Ranked High School Students Group 3 High Ranked High School Students Group 4 Job Skill Development for High School Students It is through our various educational programs that we create opportunities for young students to not only matriculate but succeed in a relevant career path Our Mission The mission of Lily Foundation is to promote charitable activities that serve humanity by providing education health and humanitarian needs The examples of such activities would be sponsoring education for some needy and meritorious children in school aid to the victims of catastrophic natural disasters and development of small local groups in education and health awareness Lily Foundation is organized exclusively for charitable and educational purposes The Vision Break the cycle of poverty through the gift of education Our Projects are SMILE Scholarships AALO Study Homes AALO Primary Coaching Homes AALO High School Coaching Homes mainstream academics Lily Education Centres Lily Vocational Centres Book Banks Health Care CSR projects Lily Foundation also supports in disaster relief programmes

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: UNITY MALANCHA, a DRAMA TROUPE OF Halisahar, 24 Parganas(North) 42 Kms away from the Capital City of Kolkata, have been able to achieve the slevel of Proficiency and skill in performing stage plays for the last two decades. It have thirty bonafide members among which 15 artists including Director, actors and technician attend rehearshal and stage shows on regular basis. Unity Malancha generally perform 20 to 22 shows per month (excepting the months of rainy season) and the artists move from one place to another all over India throughout the year. In this way the group rear up India culture and creativity and also try to step up the language of Bengali Culture. The artists of this group, not only involve themselves as participants, but also they take active parts in spreading art and culture among common people. They are also favoured by the group with remuneration for their work of art and culture. This financial assistance encourage impetus among them and is also helpful to their respective families. At the outset, members of Unity Malancha were loudy with only stage shows of plays. But from the 5th or 6th year, the members begal to organize seminars, drama-festivals, street plays, plays by children etc. by which activities of the group increased dayby day. One more remarkable programme was also organized by the group i.e. celebration of birty centenary, birth bi-centenary of great personalities or art and culture. At present Unity Malancha have chalked out a year-long programme of plays, seminars childrens playsand celebration. At least four to five days in each month the group will arrange these programme in different towns and cities and also in Kolkata to arouse enthusiasm and Zeal for art and culture among the artists. Moreover Unity Malancha will organize Theatre-training, Workshop of direction, acting, writing and technicalities of theatre. This year long programme will engage a considerable number of people artists and personalities of theatre. Unity Malancha had been trying to find out novelty, subtle creativity and snew languages of theatre by its continuous process of performing art.

ngoList.title: USHNEEK
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: USHNEEK was formed in 1984 with a group of young enthusiastic theater lovers and was registered in the year 1991-92. In this long journey USHNEEK has produced 10 full act plays, five one act plays, organized theater workshops and took part in various theater related activities. Among the full act plays- KAMAL KAMINI, received A.I.C.C award, PRAMATHESH BARUA award, UTTAM KUMAR award and many more. Late Srimati Ketaki Datta received NATTYA ACADEMI award for her performance in KAMAL KAMINI. Our previous production, GAWAHARJAAN has also received much public attention and won accolades like All India Critics Award, UTTAM KUMAR Award and PRAMATHESH BARUA AWARD. USHNEEK has participated in almost major theater festivals like NANDIKAR NATTYOSOB, NATTYA ACADEMI FESTIVAL, YUVA UTHKAL INTERNATIONAL FESTIVAL. These are only to name of few. USHNEEK has workshops for mentally challenged children for two NGOs. We have also produced a workshop based production- RAAT PARIDER RUPKATHA with both male and female sex workers of kolkata. In short from its birth USHNEEK is regularly involved in different theatrical activities like organizing workshops, seminars, play reading sessions and arranging lectures by eminent theater personalities.
